citations.narrative:
On May 21, 2025, a facility staff member found an adult female goat with her body wedged under a plastic pellet feeder
attached to the front fence panel of her enclosure and her head stuck in the corner in a space between the feeder and the
side fence panel. According to the staff member, the goat’s right front leg was also under the chain link fencing as there is
an approximately 2–3-inch gap at the bottom between the fence bar and the ground. The staff member reported
lacerations present on the goat's right front leg. The facility staff member reports they were able to free her from the fence,
but she was unable to stand and walk once freed. The facility contacted the clinical veterinarian who recommended
euthanasia due to poor prognosis. The enclosure has since not been used to house animals.
Failure to properly maintain the facility and outdoor housing facilities may result in injury and may lead to the death of the
animal.
All enclosures shall be structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury.
Correct by June 15, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.125(a)  Critical
   
Facilities, general. 
On May 21, 2025, a facility staff member found an adult female goat with her body wedged under a plastic pellet feeder 
attached to the front fence panel of her enclosure and her head stuck in the corner in a space between the feeder and the 
side fence panel. According to the staff member, the goat’s right front leg was also under the chain link fencing as there is 
an approximately 2–3-inch gap at the bottom between the fence bar and the ground. The staff member reported 
lacerations present on the goat's right front leg. The facility staff member reports they were able to free her from the fence, 
but she was unable to stand and walk once freed. The facility contacted the clinical veterinarian who recommended 
euthanasia due to poor prognosis. The enclosure has since not been used to house animals. 
 
Failure to properly maintain the facility and outdoor housing facilities may result in injury and may lead to the death of the 
animal. 
 
All enclosures shall be structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury.  
 
Correct by June 15, 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
 n
